qas.question: When did Atlantic City go through a radical building boom?
What replaced many of the modest boarding houses?
What were the names of two of the city's most distinctive hotels?

answers.text: Marlborough-Blenheim Hotel and the Traymore Hotel

qas.question: What happened to Atlantic City in the early part of the 20th century?
Where were the modest boarding houses located before they were replaced by large hotels?

context: In the <a0_0>early part of the 20th century<a0_0/>, Atlantic City went through <a3_0>a radical building boom<a3_0/>. Many of the modest boarding houses that dotted <a4_0>the boardwalk<a4_0/> were replaced with <a1_0>large hotels<a1_0/>. Two of the city's most distinctive hotels were the <a2_0>Marlborough-Blenheim Hotel and the Traymore Hotel<a2_0/>.
